content.description: This route climbs much like a boulder problem.   And with it's short stature, you could probably protect it with a few pads if you like.  Start below the right line of bolts.  Find some nice finger locks and crimps to clip the first bolt.   Make a reachy move to a sloping horizontal to clip the 2nd bolt(crux).   Continue straight up to reach the bolt anchors on the top or head slightly left and lower off the drop in shuts above Tidal Wave.   Use some caution near the top, some of the holds are a bit crispy.
content.location: This is the right most line on the Ocean Block. #2 on Ocean Wall on 2019 guide.

content.description: Start below the left line of bolts.  Climb up passing mostly positive holds.  As you approach the shuts, the holds get bigger.  The route tends to get a bit dirty toward the anchors.
content.location: Left line of bolts on the Ocean Block. #2 on Ocean Wall on 2019 guide.

content.description: This block is the furthest to climbers' left as you approach from the main trail leading to the rocks.  The two routes on the block are slightly overhung and make use of many slanting, shallow and rounded horizontals.
